tasks.title: Add getFoldersWithNoteCounts Method
changes: Add TypeScript interface: export interface FolderWithCount extends Folder { note_count: number; }
Add new service method: async getFoldersWithNoteCounts(): Promise<FolderWithCount[]>
Supabase approach (3 options):
Option 1: RPC function (requires DB function creation)
Option 2: JS computation (fetch folders and notes separately, compute in JS)
Option 3: Use Supabase aggregate if available
Recommended: Option 2 (JS computation) for simplicity and no DB changes

option1_rpc.description: Create PostgreSQL function, call via supabase.rpc()
option1_rpc.sql:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_folders_with_counts()
RETURNS TABLE(id UUID, name TEXT, note_count BIGINT) AS $$
  SELECT f.id, f.name, COUNT(n.id) as note_count
  FROM folders f
  LEFT JOIN notes n ON f.id = n.folder_id
  GROUP BY f.id
  ORDER BY f.name ASC
$$ LANGUAGE sql;

option2_js_computation.description: Fetch folders and notes separately, compute counts in JavaScript
option2_js_computation.pros: Simple, no DB changes, works immediately
option2_js_computation.cons: Fetches all notes (may be slow with 1000+ notes)

option3_aggregate.description: Use Supabase aggregate functions if available
option3_aggregate.note: Check Supabase docs for aggregate support in current version

tasks.recommendation: Use Option 2 (JS computation) for Phase 2. Can optimize later with RPC if performance becomes an issue.
